com.example.stanza

Class UserPoemFragment

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.example.stanza.UserPoemFragment

  • public class UserPoemFragment
extends java.lang.Object
    A class representing the User Poem fragment, which contains a list of the user's poems. Appears under the "My Poems" tab in the dashboard page.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods

      Called when MainActivity has been created and the User Poem fragment's view hierarchy has been instantiated.

      Instantiate and return a new Loader for user's poems in the database.

      Initialize the content of MainActivity's standard options menu.

      Called to have the User Poem fragment instantiate its user interface view.
      void onItemDismiss(int position)
      called when the user swipes a poem card to the left.
      void onItemMove(int fromPosition, int toPosition)
      Called when the poem cards within the User Poem fragment are moved by dragging and dropping (this feature is not implemented yet).

      Called when a previously created loader has finished its load.

      This hook is called whenever an item in the options menu is selected, and will perform the proper actions based on whatever option was selected.
      void restartLoader()
      Starts a new or restarts an existing Loader in this manager, registers the callbacks implemented in this class, and (if the fragment is currently started) starts loading it.

    • Method Detail

      • onCreateView

        @Nullable
public View onCreateView(LayoutInflater inflater,
                                    @Nullable
                                    ViewGroup container,
                                    @Nullable
                                    Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called to have the User Poem fragment instantiate its user interface view.
        Parameters:
        inflater - The LayoutInflater object that can be used to inflate any views in the fragment.
        container - The parent view that the User Poem fragment's UI should be attached to.
        savedInstanceState - If non-null, this fragment is being re-constructed from a previous saved state as given here.
        Returns:
        The View for the User Poem Fragment's UI.

      • onActivityCreated

        public void onActivityCreated(@Nullable
                              Bundle savedInstanceState)
        Called when MainActivity has been created and the User Poem fragment's view hierarchy has been instantiated.
        Parameters:
        savedInstanceState - If the fragment is being re-created from a previous saved state, this is the state.

      • onCreateOptionsMenu

        public void onCreateOptionsMenu(Menu menu,
                                MenuInflater inflater)
        Initialize the content of MainActivity's standard options menu. The menu items for the User Poem fragment are only displayed when the fragment is visible.
        Parameters:
        menu - The options menu in which items are placed.
        inflater - A MenuInflater object used to instantiate menu_userpoemfragment.xml into Menu objects

      • onOptionsItemSelected

        public boolean onOptionsItemSelected(MenuItem item)
        This hook is called whenever an item in the options menu is selected, and will perform the proper actions based on whatever option was selected.
        Parameters:
        item - The MenuItem that was selected.
        Returns:
        Returns false to allow normal menu processing to proceed, true to override normal menu processing.

      • restartLoader

        public void restartLoader()
        Starts a new or restarts an existing Loader in this manager, registers the callbacks implemented in this class, and (if the fragment is currently started) starts loading it.

      • onCreateLoader

        public android.support.v4.content.Loader<Cursor> onCreateLoader(int id,
                                                                Bundle args)
        Instantiate and return a new Loader for user's poems in the database.
        Parameters:
        id - The ID whose loader is to be created.
        args - Any arguments supplied by the caller.
        Returns:
        A new Loader instance that is ready to start loading.

      • onLoadFinished

        public void onLoadFinished(android.support.v4.content.Loader<Cursor> loader,
                           Cursor data)
        Called when a previously created loader has finished its load. Provides PoemRecyclerAdapter with the data generated by the loader.
        Parameters:
        loader - The Loader that has finished.
        data - The data generated by the Loader.

      • onLoaderReset

        public void onLoaderReset(android.support.v4.content.Loader<Cursor> loader)
        Called when a previously created loader is being reset, and thus making its data unavailable. Removes references to the Loader's data within PoemRecyclerAdapter.
        Parameters:
        loader - The Loader that is being reset.

      • onActivityResult

        public void onActivityResult(int requestCode,
                             int resultCode,
                             Intent data)
        Receive the result from a previous call to startActivityForResult(Intent, int). Responds accordingly for the results from specific activities.
        Parameters:
        requestCode - The integer request code originally supplied to startActivityForResult(), allowing us to identify which activity this result came from.
        resultCode - The integer result code returned by the child activity through its setResult().
        data - An Intent, which can return result data to the caller.

      • onItemMove

        public void onItemMove(int fromPosition,
                       int toPosition)
        Called when the poem cards within the User Poem fragment are moved by dragging and dropping (this feature is not implemented yet).
        Parameters:
        fromPosition - The initial position of the card within the RecyclerView.
        toPosition - The final position of the card within the RecyclerView.

      • onItemDismiss

        public void onItemDismiss(int position)
        called when the user swipes a poem card to the left. This will delete the poem.
        Parameters:
        position - The position of the card within the RecyclerView.
